title: Wave 14: Arena Mode
description: Windsurf released Arena Mode, bringing side-by-side model comparison directly to the IDE. Users can run two Cascade agents simultaneously with hidden model identities and vote on performance. Also introduced Plan Mode with a 'megaplan' advanced form for asking clarifying questions.

community_feedback.quote: Windsurf推出Arena Mode: 一個prompt, 兩個模型, 同場競技
Benchmarks don't reflect real-world coding quality. The best model depends on your actual use cases.
Discussion about comparing models on actual codebase rather than benchmark scores

title: Claude Opus 4.6 Support
description: Added support for Claude Opus 4.6 with limited-time promotional pricing: 2x credits for 'no thinking' mode and 3x credits for 'with thinking' mode. Available in Arena Mode's Frontier Arena and Hybrid Arena.

title: GPT-5.2-Codex Support
description: Added support for GPT-5.2-Codex with four reasoning efforts (low, medium, high, and xhigh). Described as OpenAI's latest model designed for agentic coding, excelling at working in large codebases over long sessions.

title: Agent Skills Support
description: Windsurf now supports Agent Skills for Cascade, allowing users to extend Cascade's functionality with custom skills.

title: Devin Review Launch
description: Devin Review is a reimagined interface for understanding complex PRs. It groups related changes together logically, detects copied code, detects bugs and security issues, and includes an embedded PR chat interface. Claims to reduce PR review time by 50%.

community_feedback.quote: Noted that public PRs don't require a Devin account
Discussion about accessibility model and token costs

title: Session Secrets via API
description: New API endpoints allow providing session-scoped secrets when creating sessions, enabling secure credential management for automated workflows without manual intervention.

title: Sessions API Enhancements
description: New API endpoints allow retrieving session details by ID, sending messages to active sessions, and filtering sessions by origin (webapp, Slack, Teams, API, Linear, Jira).

title: Native Linear Integration
description: Devin now has a built-in Linear tool for organizations with the Linear integration installed, eliminating the need to install the Linear MCP separately.

title: CLI Agent Mode and Cloud Handoff
description: Big update to Cursor CLI including Agent modes (Plan and Ask), Cloud handoff for background tasks, and one-click MCP auth availability. This update brings many of the most popular features from the editor to the CLI.

community_feedback.quote: Thank you for improving Cursor CLI. The experience is still not as good as Claude Code or OpenCode but it's improving slowly.
Significantly faster for focused, new code generation

title: CLI Performance Improvements
description: Brand new CLI features and performance improvements released in early January 2026.

title: Agent-Driven Workflows in VS Code v1.109
description: January 2026 release brought agent-driven workflows to GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code, along with significant improvements to the Copilot experience.

community_feedback.quote: Discussion about slow start-stop cycles affecting Copilot Agent workflow in GitHub webapp
Hands-on review of new GitHub Agents Tab for repo-level Copilot coding agent workflows

title: Visual Studio January Update
description: January update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio introduced colorized code completions, partial acceptance of code completions, and productivity improvements.

title: Claude Code 2.1.26–2.1.30 Updates
description: Multiple releases in January 2026 bringing 6 new features, 7 improvements, and 12 bug fixes. Strong focus on performance, MCP (Model Context Protocol), and GitHub integration improvements.

community_feedback.quote: Not flashy, but a very solid technical update
Lower memory usage, faster session resumes

title: Claude Code 2.1 Major Update
description: Major 2.1.0 release with 1,096 commits bringing new features including Shift+Enter for line breaks, Esc+Esc for undo, Ctrl+B for background operation, Skills system upgrades with multi-language support, wildcard permissions, and dynamic MCP detection.

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code 2.1.0 Just Changed Everything, And Most Developers Haven't Noticed Yet
Quietly rewrote the rules with smoother workflows and smarter agents

title: Cowork Feature for Pro Plan
description: Cowork feature became available to Pro plan users on Claude Desktop (macOS only).

title: Agent Loop Feature
description: OpenAI unveiled Codex CLI's 'agent loop' for enhanced software automation, detailing user-model interactions and software change orchestration.

title: Model Retirement and Updates
description: GPT-4o and other legacy models were retired on January 29, 2026. Users advised to update CLI to see GPT-5.3-Codex model capabilities.

community_feedback.quote: Some users reported changes in progress log granularity after recent updates

title: v0.24.0 Release
description: Released on January 14, 2026 with significant advancements in Agent Skills, improved UI/UX, enhanced security, and various core functionality improvements.

title: v0.26.0 Update
description: Released on January 26, 2026 with Agent Skills feature for extending Gemini CLI functionality and new hooks capability.

title: Discussions in AI Coding Community
description: Aider continues to be actively discussed as one of the top open-source AI coding assistants. Users mention it as a cost-effective terminal-driven alternative ($1-2 per session) compared to Claude Code and Cursor. Used with various models including Sonnet and DeepSeek.

community_feedback.quote: Aider was something I liked and used quite heavily (with sonnet)
I rarely break $1-2 a session using aider
Discussion about consistency issues with AI coding assistants
